body:
A common question by aspiring engineers in the earlier stages of their career tends to be - how do I become a senior engineer?
While the answer to this question can depend on various factors that are specific to each company, in general there tends to be a number of qualities common to all senior engineers.
When an engineer displays a certain depth in each of these areas they begin to be recognised by their peers as a senior engineer.
Technical Skills Possibly the easiest to classify - the expectation is an engineer should possess an equivalent level of technical skill to other senior engineers in the organization. Both range and depth will be expected, and while the exact ratio will depend on the organization and department, a level of deeper knowledge will be expected in at least some areas.
In addition to acquiring skill in the technologies and tools they use, an engineer will be expected to be possess a certain level of security and networking knowledge, and contribute to software architecture and system design discussions. The ability to learn new skills and technologies efficiently is also expected.
Technical Quality As a senior engineer, you will be one of the role models jun
standards bearer maintainability Technical Leadership lead and own technical initiatives within the team include mentoring and knowledge sharing here also understand trade-off's ability to lead design technical judgement Responsibility include being solid/ a set of trusted hands Team Skills include communication here also backup for team lead Organization ability to handle multiple types of tasks ability to follow-up Mentoring mentoring of junior engineers/ in specific technical areas
title: Qualities of a Senior Engineer

body:
Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows.
Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including:
https://github.com/yuin/goldmark https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop https://github.com/spf13/cobra https://github.com/spf13/viper Hugo is ideal for blogs, corporate websites, creative portfolios, online magazines, single page applications or even a website with thousands of pages.
Hugo is for people who want to hand code their own website without worrying about setting up complicated runtimes, dependencies and databases.
Websites built with Hugo are extremelly fast, secure and can be deployed anywhere including, AWS, GitHub Pages, Heroku, Netlify and any other hosting provider.
Learn more and contribute on GitHub.
title: About
